quote: Captain's log, stardate 45233.1.   Our terraforming mission to Doraf   One has been suddenly cancelled   and the Enterprise recalled to   Starbase Two-thirty-four. Fleet   Admiral Brackett would not discuss   the matter on subspace for   reasons she said would soon be   clear...
I apologize for the mystery,   Captain... but we must attempt   to contain the information I'm   about to reveal to you... at least   as long as possible...
I will admit you've piqued my   curiosity, Admiral.
Three weeks ago, one of our most   celebrated ambassadors -- an   advisor to Federation leaders for   generations -- disappeared. He   left no word of his destination.

Two days ago, intelligence reports   placed him on Romulus -- and I   assure you it's an unauthorized   visit. Computer, initiate linkage   between this terminal and starbase   computer system alpha-two-nine.
Linkage complete.
A defection?
If it is, the damage to Federation   security would be incalculable.
Taken on Romulus, by long-range   scanner. Computer, enhance image   in section four-delta.

Captain's log, stardate 45236.4.   As I study the intelligence   reports on Ambassador Spock's   disappearance, I cannot help but   feel a deeper, more personal   concern about this mission, for   I know this man through his   father. It was barely a year ago   that I shared a mind meld with   the Vulcan Sarek... now we must   meet again as I attempt to find   an explanation for his son's   actions.
We'll be coming into orbit of   Vulcan in less than an hour,   Captain... you may want to get   some rest...
Yes, yes, of course, you're   right...
We should notify Sarek's wife of   our plans...
All taken care of, sir... she'll   be transporting aboard at oh-seven   hundred...
And Sarek?
She says he is too ill to join   her.
Not unexpected. The man is dying.   And I have the... honor... to   bring him the news that his son   may have betrayed the Federation.
How well do you know Spock?
I met him only once... what I know   of him comes from history books   and of course the mind meld with   his father...
That must cover a lot of ground...
Not as much as you'd imagine...   Sarek and Spock...
... Well, sometimes, fathers and   sons...
(from personal     experience)   Understood.
Oh there was one other thing...   take a look at this...
Something that turned up during   the intelligence sweep... what   do you make of it?
Metal fragments, possibly   disassembled components,   identified as Vulcan... recovered   from a downed Ferengi ship...
And the crates they were in were   marked as medical supplies.
Contraband?
They've been sent to Vulcan for   identification... Starfleet has   requested we lend them a hand...
Captain Picard...
Perrin...
It's good to see you again.
And you. How is Sarek?
He has good days... and bad days.   More and more they're bad...
Then the disease has progressed...
It is a cruel killer. Sarek   deserves a noble death... instead   he is trapped in this lingering   madness...
It must be very hard for you.
Every day I can share with him   is a gift. The pain will be in   losing him.
I hope that will not be soon.
There's no way to tell. At times   I think he won't make it through   another night... and then it seems   he's strong enough to live for   years...
I admire your strength more than   I can tell you.
Mint tea... it's been years since   I've had it... Vulcans have some   strange concoction they call   "mint"... but you wouldn't   recognize it...
Perrin... you know why I've come   to Vulcan.
I must ask you about Spock.
He didn't even say good-bye to   his father before he left.
Is it possible he was abducted?
No. He wrapped up his affairs   very carefully. He knew he was   going.
Do you have any idea why he might   have disappeared like this?
Captain, as far as I'm concerned   he disappeared a long time ago.
Excuse me for sounding like the   wicked stepmother...
Would it be inappropriate to ask   what happened between you and   Spock?

Not between us. Between Spock   and his father. They had argued   for years; that was family...   but when the debates over the   Cardassian war began, he attacked   Sarek's position... publicly...   he showed no loyalty to his   father...
I was not aware that Sarek was   offended by Spock's opposition...
I was offended. And I made sure   Spock knew it.       I am very protective of my   husband. I do not apologize for   it.
Would Sarek have any idea why   Spock might have left?
I don't know.       If you could see Sarek as I do...   wasting in bed... whispering to   himself...
He wants to see his son... to heal   any rifts that still remain...   but now it may be too late.
Perrin... would you allow me to   see Sarek?
If it were anyone else... I would   never permit it.
But you are a part of him... and   he of you...
The Vulcans can't figure out what   these fragments are... but   they've identified the metal as   a dentarium alloy.
That pretty well indicates   that they're Vulcan...       And dentarium also means that   whatever this was, it was designed   for use in space.
From the look of the damage,   must've been a high-speed impact.
A Ferengi cargo shuttle that went   down in the Hanolin asteroid   belt... the debris was spread over   one hundred square kilometers.
Could it be a weapons array?
That was my first thought. But   the Vulcans don't have any record   of stolen weapons. Or stolen   parts, for that matter.
This is gonna be like putting   together a big jig-saw puzzle when   you don't know what the picture   is supposed to be.
He's like this most of the time...   his emotions have taken over.
Sometimes I can bring him out of   it.
Sarek! You will listen!
Go from me!
Picard is here.
No -- more -- chaos!
I'll leave you alone. He'll   either acknowledge you... or he   won't.
Sarek, I have come a long way to   see you.
I will not answer -- !
I must speak to you about your   son...
I want no one with me --
About Spock.
Spock?
Yes. He's missing.
Is that you, Picard... ?
Yes, my friend.
You came here... to Vulcan...
I need your help. I must find   Spock.
He is not here...
I know. He is reported on   Romulus.
On Romulus... why?
That's what I hope to find out   from you.
On Romulus...
You're going there, aren't you?   To find him.
Yes.
Have you any idea what might have   taken him to Romulus?
No.
Is there anyone on Romulus that   he might know... or choose to   contact?
Pardek...
Who is Pardek?
It could be Pardek...
Who is Pardek?
He is a Romulan Senator. Spock   has maintained a relationship with   him over the years... I don't know   where they met. The Khitomer   Conference, I'd imagine.
Pardek represented Romulus?
Yes... yes I'm quite sure he   did...

... in fact I recall Spock coming   to me with optimism about a   continuing dialogue with the   Romulans at one point... and I   told him it was clearly an   illogical expectation... Spock   is always so impressionable...   this Romulan Pardek had no support   at home... and of course in the   end, I was proven correct.
I tried to give him the benefit   of experience, of logic... but   he never listened. He never   listened...
It has been suggested... that   Spock may have defected.
Never. I can accept many things,   but not that.
But you believe he might be there   to see Pardek...
The Romulan Senator? How do you   know Pardek?
I've heard of him.
That's what he's done. Gone to   see Pardek.
Do you know what business they   could have together?
No.       I never knew what Spock was doing.   When he was a boy, he would   disappear for days into the   mountains.

I asked him where he had gone,   what he had done... he refused   to answer. I insisted he tell   me... but he would not. I forbade   him to go... he ignored me. I   punished him... he endured it   silently. And always, he returned   to the mountains.       One might as well tell the river   not to flow...
Secretly... I admired him... that   proud core of him that would not   yield...
Sarek, we are a part of each   other. I know Spock has caused   you pain... but I also know you   love him...
Tell him, Picard...
Peace and long life, Sarek.
Live long and... and...       ... live long and...
Spock... my son...
... and prosper.

Captain's log, stardate 45240.1.   To cross the Neutral Zone, I will   require a cloaked ship. To that   end, I have set a course for the   Klingon Home World. After all we   did for Gowron during the recent   war, I am certain he will be happy   to return a favor.
Still no response from the   Klingons, Mister Worf?
Nossir.
He's ignoring me... what other   explanation is there?
Seems like, after three days of   hailing him, he could've found   a minute to talk to you...
Sir...
Yes, Lieutenant?
I believe I know why our messages   are not being answered. Gowron...   has been rewriting Klingon   history.
Rewriting history?
He is claiming that it was his   courage... his genius... which   brought about an end to the civil   war.
I see.
In the new version... there is   no mention made of the   Federation's help in his rise to   power.
If Worf's right, our arrival   would be an uncomfortable   reminder of the facts...

Victors re-write the history   books. He can take every bit of   credit, I'll gladly grant him   that. But I need a ship.       If Gowron won't talk to me... get   somebody who will, somebody on   the High Council, K'Tal perhaps...
Yes, Captain.
Captain, I have a visual   identification of Senator Pardek   of Romulus...
This is a Barolian record of a   trade negotiation in which Pardek   participated four years ago...
That's all?
Yessir.
Run it again.
Call up the intelligence   scan of Spock on Romulus...
Same man... Pardek...
One question answered.       What do we know of him?

He has been in public service   since he was a young man... a   senator for nine decades. He is   considered a "man of the   people... " He has sponsored many   reforms. Reportedly, he is   considered by the Romulan   leadership to be something of a   radical because he has been an   advocate for peace throughout his   career.
I can see why Spock would   cultivate a relationship with him.
Yessir.
Where are we likely to find him   -- other than on the floor of the   Romulan Senate?
The district he represents is   called the Krocton Segment. He   maintains a dwelling there.
Very good, Mister Data.

There is more, sir... I took the   liberty of expanding the   perameters of my search... and   have discovered that Pardek has   several relatives in the Krocton   Segment. It is likely that you   will be able to locate him there   on the third day of the Romulan   week when the Senate is not in   session.
Your resourcefulness never ceases   to amaze me.
Thank you, sir.
If I ever get to Romulus, Data,   I am going to need help. I'd like   you to accompany me.
To the surface, sir?
Yes...
I understand how you can be made   to look Romulan, but I believe   it will be more difficult to   transform an android, Captain.
I think Doctor Crusher can come   up with something...
Captain... we are being hailed   by the Klingon Home World.
Gowron or K'Tal?
Neither, sir... it is the junior   adjutant to the diplomatic   delegation.
Junior adjutant.
Name.
B'ijik, sir.
On screen.
Greetings, Captain. I regret to   inform you that Gowron and the   High Council are quite busy and   won't be able to speak with you   today.
Is he aware that we've been   transmitting messages for three   days?
Messages? I'll have to inspect   the logs... but I'm sure we   haven't received any...
It is of the utmost importance   that I speak with Gowron...

Captain, Gowron wishes it were   possible to talk with everyone   who wants an audience. But he   is one man... the demands on his   time are formidable. If you would   like me to take him a message...
A message. Very well.
Tell Gowron, Leader of the High   Council of the Klingon Empire,   that his Arbiter of Succession,   Jean-Luc Picard, needs a favor.
A favor?
I require a cloaked vessel.
A cloaked vessel. This is no   small favor, Captain.
It is for a mission that could   have repercussions throughout the   quadrant.
How would it benefit the Klingon   Empire? I'm sure Gowron will   ask...
The only benefit to the Klingon   Empire... would be our gratitude.
That's what you want me to tell   Gowron... .?
Yes. And please add that if he   is unable to provide a ship, I   am sure there are others in the   Klingon Empire who would be   willing to help me. And then they   would have our gratitude.
I see.
Also please tell him that I am   immensely gratified that he is   prospering so well. It is a   tribute to his skilled leadership.
They aren't removable, are they,   Data?
Removable, Doctor?
Your ears.
No, Doctor... they are fully   integrated components.
We'll need molds of his ears   too...
What about his skin color?
We'll have to do some tests with   his skin pigmentation. Changing   it to appear Romulan shouldn't   be too hard... I just want to be   sure we can change it back again   afterwards.
The right eye is point-zero-zero-   four higher than the left...
It is not...
You want a proper fit on your   prosthetic? Trust your tailor.
I won't tell a soul, sir.
Anything from Gowron?
Nosir. But after your tailor is   done, would you join me in the   cargo bay... La Forge has made   some progress on those metal   fragments...
These two still have to report   to Mister Mott to get their   hairpieces designed...
Thirty minutes, Number One.
What we seem to have here is a   navigational deflector array.   Or at least what's left of one.
Why would anyone want a Vulcan   deflector?
Beats me, Commander. Every   question we answer here seems to   bring up two more.
You're certain it is Vulcan...
Yes, sir. A metallurgical   analysis confirmed that... and   by running a molecular pattern   trace, we even identified the ship   as the T'Pau.
It was decommissioned years ago   and sent to the surplus depot at   Qualor Two. As far as anyone   knows it's still there.
Worf to Captain Picard...
Yes, Lieutenant?
A Klingon vessel is decloaking   off our port bow. Compliments   of Gowron.
Please convey our gratitude,   Mister Worf. Advise the captain   that Lieutenant Commander Data   and I will be transporting aboard   shortly.
Aye, sir.
I'd like to take the Enterprise   to Qualor Two... see what I can   find out there.
Agreed.
When I received my orders... I   was not told where we were going.
But the heading I was given...   takes us into the Neutral Zone...   and to Romulus.
That's right.
I know my duty, Captain... when   I'm given orders, I follow them.       But I do not like secrets. I want   to know why we are on this   mission.
I'm sorry. It is a confidential   matter.
You're going after the defector,   aren't you?
Defector...
You think information like that   stays a secret? Ambassador Spock   has gone to Romulus... and you're   going after him.
Your orders are to take us to a   set of coordinates near Romulus...   and to bring us back. That is   all I am prepared to discuss.
If we are discovered by the   Romulans... it means death for   all of us.
I realize that.
Hechu' ghoS...       Very well, Captain. We have set   a course for Romulus.
It may not be what you're used   to on a Starfleet ship.
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: Quite nice. Thank you.
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: Is this the captain's quarters,   or mine?
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: Both.
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: We have limited space. We're a   military ship, not a pleasure   craft.
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: Of course. This will be fine.
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: You'll sleep Klingon style... we   don't soften our bodies by putting   down a pad...
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: Good. I prefer it that way.
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: You'll take your meals with us...   and we don't serve Federation   food.
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: I haven't had gagh in a while...   been looking forward to it. Very   fresh.
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: MeH HoD...
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: Jatlh!
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: MeHmaH ghoS... (We are   approaching the Neutral Zone.)
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: So'wl'chu'. (Prepare to engage   the cloaking device.)
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: Well, Captain... we're at the   border of the Neutral Zone.       You mean to do this, do you?
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: Yes. I do.
scene: 18   INT. BIRD OF PREY - KLINGON QUARTERS

quote: First Officer's log, stardate   45240.6. The Enterprise is   nearing Qualor Two -- home of a   Federation surplus depot operated   by the Zakdorn. We hope to find   out how the salvaged deflector   array ended up in the hands of   the Ferengi.
I have made contact, Commander.
On screen.
I'm Commander William Riker of   the Federation Starship   Enterprise.
Klim Dokachin, quartermaster of   Surplus Depot Zed-One-Five.
We need some information about   a Vulcan ship, the T'Pau. It was   sent there a few years ago.
Did you arrange an appointment?
Appointment... no...
Then I will be unable to help you.   You may communicate with   scheduling.
Who does he think he is?
The quartermaster of the surplus   yard, Commander. With information   you need.
Right. Mister Worf...   reestablish communication.
Yes, sir.
Mister Dokaychin...
Dokahchin... Klim Dokahchin...
Mister Dokahchin, the information   I need involves a matter of major   importance to the Federation.
Uh huh.
I'll need access to your logs,   your files...       It won't take long. My people   can do the work.
I don't allow outsiders into my   computer system.
Fine. One of your people, then.
I wish I had the people to spare.   I don't.
Well, sir... what would you   suggest?
I don't know. Contact me when   you reach orbit.
I don't believe him.
He's king of his particular hill,   Commander. You'll have to treat   him that way.
Counselor... a perfect job for   you.
Thank you for coming on board,   Mister Dokachin.
Quite a ship you have.
We've tied into your computers.   If you could access the files...
I don't usually see them in such   good condition. By the time they   get to me, they're always falling   apart.
Mister Dokachin, we must find this   ship -- and you're the only one   who can help us.
Who're you?
Deanna Troi, Ship's Counselor.
He probably figures we don't get   to see a lot of handsome women   out this way -- and someone like   you might get a little more   cooperation from me.
He's probably right.
What was the name of that ship?   The T'Pau?       The T'Pau... Vulcan registry...       There. Logged in on stardate   41334.
Where is the ship now?
Docked.       Section eighteen-gamma-twelve.   Do you want me to take you there?
I'd appreciate that.
Helmsman, lay in a heading   one-four-one by two-zero-eight.   Ahead slow, two hundred kph.
I suppose this is your first time   in a junkyard, isn't it? You'd   be surprised at some of the things   I find on board these ships...
I once found a fourteen foot   Caldorian eel on board a   freighter... in someone's   locker...
Are you serious?
If you have time, I'll show it   to you... I still have it...   nursed her back to health...
Commander, we are approaching the   designated coordinates.
On screen.
Where is it? What happened to   it?
These are the correct   coordinates...
The T'Pau is missing?
The T'Pau...       ... is missing.
How could a ship disappear from   your depot?
I'm not accustomed to losing   things, Commander. I'll find your   ship for you.    (as he furiously works     the keys)   I have the T'Pau cross-referenced   in four different directories...
When it was brought here... was   it stripped of materiel --   armament, sensors... ?
Of course...
Can you tell us what happened   to its navigational deflector?
It was routed to the Tripoli, a   holding vessel on the outer rim   of the shipyard.
It's not there anymore. What's   left of that deflector is laid   out on the floor of our cargo bay.
How can that be?
Maybe we ought to pay a visit to   the Tripoli...
In all the time the Zakdorn have   operated this depot, nothing's   ever been lost. Never. I'll   tell you this... somebody will   pay. I'll conduct an   investigation. Whoever is   responsible...
Approaching the coordinates of   the Tripoli, sir.
On screen.
I do not understand this. This   is not possible.
We beam goods to the Tripoli on   a regular schedule. There was   a shipment yesterday, and another   is set for today. It must be   there.
When is today's transport?
Just over two hours from now.   A shipment of deuterium storage   tanks.
Ensign, align the Enterprise so   we'll appear to be one of the   abandoned ships. Mister La Forge,   when we're in position, shut down   engines and all systems except   sensors and life support.
Aye, sir.
I'm guessing somebody's going to   be here to receive those storage   tanks -- and I'd be very   interested to see who it is.
These quarters were obviously   intended for only one crewmember,   sir. There is a single sleeping   space.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: I'm sure the Klingons found it   amusing to put us together in   here.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Since I do not require sleep, I   propose you take the --    (not sure what to call     the hole in the wall)   -- shelf. I will be content to   stand.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Very well, Mister Data. Thank   you.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Are you comfortable, sir?
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: I suppose so.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Good-night, Captain. Sleep well.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Thank you.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: What are you doing?
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Sir? Was I making noise?
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Not exactly...
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: I was processing the information   we have accumulated on Romulan   society. I am preparing for the   task of impersonating a Romulan.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: I see.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Would you like me to discontinue?
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: No, no. Please go ahead.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: What are you looking at?
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: I am not looking at anything, sir.   I am continuing to organize my   files.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: But you're looking at me.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: I am sorry if I am disturbing you,   sir. I will not look in your   direction.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Sir, do you not wish to sleep?
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: I don't think so. Shall we   continue to go over the files?
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: I would be happy to.    (launching in without     further ado)   I have been studying the Krocton   Segment, as you asked, and have   selected an appropriate site for   our transport...
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Captain K'Vada to Picard... please   come to the bridge.
scene: 27   INT. KLINGON BIRD OF PREY - QUARTERS

quote: Captain... we've monitored a   subspace message that might   interest you.
Thank you, Captain.
Sarek is dead.
Commander... sensors detect a ship   approaching at warp speed.
Identification?
Negative. No transponder   signal... no subspace marker...
Sounds like they don't want to   be identified.
The ship is coming out of warp   now...
On screen.

Sensors indicate a combat   vessel... origin undetermined...   heavily armed... mass and density   suggest it's fully loaded with   cargo. From the look of these   internal scans, I'd guess a good   part of that cargo is weaponry.
The ship is moving into section   twelve delta four...
It's taking the position assigned   to the Tripoli. The coordinates   are identical.
Commander... readings indicate   the surface-to-ship transport has   begun...
Bring the engines back on line,   Mister La Forge... And restore   all systems to normal.
Aye, sir.
He's powering up engines, sir --   turning starboard.
Open a channel.
Open, sir.
This is Commander William Riker   of the U.S.S. Enterprise.   Identify yourself.
I repeat... you have entered a   Federation depot... identify   yourself.
Sir, the ship is locking   phasers...
Shields up. Red alert.
That ship easily matches our   armament, Commander.
It's coming about...
If you do not respond to our   hails, we will take that as   evidence of hostile action.
There is an energy build-up in   their phaser banks... sir, they   are activating weapons!
Forward shields down to   seventy-two percent --
Boost power to the shields...
Aye, sir.
Mister Worf, target their weapon   systems only and prepare to fire--
Forward shields at sixty-eight   percent, aft shields forty   percent...
On my mark, a point-seven-five   burst only. We just want to get   their attention.
Ready, sir.
Fire.
Their forward shields are damaged,   sir...

We destroyed one of their phaser   arrays... looks like collateral   damage in the cargo area...    (beat, reacting to     sensor readings)   Sir, I'm picking up massive power   fluctuations... internal   explosions... with all the   armament that ship is carrying   -- it's gonna blow!
Well, Mister Data...
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: ... what do you think?
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: I am very pleased, sir. I would   not have thought it possible.
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: I am eager to test the success   of our efforts. It does remain   to be seen if the Romulans will   accept us.
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: Sir, you have seemed unusually   pensive since we received the news   of Ambassador Sarek's death.
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: Sarek and I shared a particular   bond. Our lives touched in an   unusual way... I admit that I   feel the effects of his loss.
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: The tenor of our mission has   changed, at least for me, Data.   We were sent to confront Spock   about his disappearance. Now,   we must also tell him his father   is dead.
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: I am afraid I do not entirely   understand, sir. As a Vulcan,   would not Ambassador Spock simply   see death as a logical result of   his father's illness... ?
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: It is never quite that simple.   Not even for a Vulcan. Certainly   not for Spock who is also half   Human.       They spent a lifetime in   conflict... now the chance to   resolve all of their differences   is gone.
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: Considering the exceptionally long   lifespan of Vulcans, it does seem   odd that Spock and Sarek did not   choose to resolve their   differences in the time   available.
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: Yes. It really is quite...   illogical...       A father and son... both proud,   both stubborn... more alike than   either would care to admit.   They've spent a lifetime building   emotional barriers. Those aren't   easy to break down.
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: And then the time comes when it   is too late to try. One realizes   that all the things he had   planned to say will go unsaid.       That is a difficult moment... and   a lonely one. Spock will now   have to face that moment.
scene: 35A  INT. KLINGON QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A HAND MIRROR

quote: Don't you two look sweet...
Be careful, android... some   Romulan beauty might take a liking   to you... lick that paint right   off your ears...
Do you know what the Romulans will   do to you if they discover who   you are?
I have a good idea.       We are ready to be transported   to the surface.
Just so we understand each other   -- my orders don't include rescue   missions.
Ah, Senator Pardek. You received   my message.
I got here as quickly as I could,   Proconsul.
What do you know of this Human?   Jean-Luc Picard... a Starfleet   Captain...
I know nothing of him.
You haven't seen him recently... ?
To my knowledge, I've never seen   him.
I have received intelligence that   says he's on his way here.   Perhaps here already.
Here -- on Romulus?
Yes... curious, isn't it? I   suppose we'd better find out if   the report is accurate -- or   merely rumor.
Circulate his likeness to the   security forces. Remind them that   if he is here, he is probably   disguised as one of us.
I'll see to it.
This is definitely the street on   which the intelligence scan   of Spock and Pardek was taken,   sir... adjusting for the optical   distortion, I am able to verify   the architectural features...
Where were they standing?
Data...
Sir?
You're moving about in a very...   well, android manner...
I am sorry, Captain. I will be   more careful.
And don't call me "Captain."
Yes, Cap --       I understand.       I have located the place where   they were standing...
Where?
It is here --       -- at this doorway.
A legal intercessor's office...   the name is similar to Pardek's.   It would appear to be one of   his relatives.
Not open for business yet...
Nevertheless, it would be my   recommendation that we keep this   location under observation.
I have clearly determined   Pardek's routine. On days when   the Senate is not in session, he   invariably comes to this section   after the median hour.
Very well, why don't we take the   opportunity to try some of the   local cuisine...
What do you recommend?
Soup.
That sounds very appealing. I   will have soup.
Soup is fine.
Do you happen to know what time   the intercessor's office across   the way opens?
Why do you want to know?
I need his services... he was   recommended.
I haven't seen you here before.
We are here for the day... from   the city of Rateg.
Rateg. I don't think so.
Why do you say that?
You don't sound like you're from   Rateg.
It is a misconception that all   Rategs speak with a particular   inflection. In fact, there are   twelve different --
We come from several kilometers   outside the city...
Or perhaps you come from the   security forces, to watch the   intercessor's office. Is he in   trouble?
Madam, you are mistaken.
It doesn't matter to me. I don't   know when he opens. Eat your   soup. Courtesy of a loyal   establishment. Jolan True.
We can't stay here long.
We may not have to... Direct your   view to the far corner... is that   not Pardek?
I believe you're right...
Perhaps you should appear to   enjoy your soup.
Do not move.
What? You've made a mistake...
Quiet. Come with us...
Wait here.
scene: 57   INT. ROMULAN CAVES - A LITTLE LATER

quote: For what? Why have you brought   us here?
scene: 57   INT. ROMULAN CAVES - A LITTLE LATER

quote: Welcome to Romulus, Captain   Picard.
scene: 57   INT. ROMULAN CAVES - A LITTLE LATER

quote: Don't let our "soldiers" alarm   you... we had to get you off the   streets quickly. Romulan security   knows you are here.
scene: 57   INT. ROMULAN CAVES - A LITTLE LATER

quote: I am Pardek... you are among   friends, Captain.
scene: 57   INT. ROMULAN CAVES - A LITTLE LATER

quote: I have come on an urgent mission   from the Federation. I am looking   for Ambassador Spock.
scene: 57   INT. ROMULAN CAVES - A LITTLE LATER

quote: Indeed...
scene: 57   INT. ROMULAN CAVES - A LITTLE LATER

quote: You have found him, Captain   Picard.
scene: 57   INT. ROMULAN CAVES - A LITTLE LATER
